alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 21 at 4:03AM MST until December 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON... .Very dry and locally breezy conditions will result in several hours of critical fire weather conditions this afternoon for the Cheyenne Ridge, foothills, and portions of the Palmer Divide. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHERN FOOTHILLS BELOW 7500 FT... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 215. * Timing...9 AM to 5 PM MST. * Winds...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that develop are likely to spread rapidly. Outdoor burning should be avoided, as well as any activities that may cause sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet
